answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that might be helpful.
Below are places with Sentencing to Service programs in place.
Hennepin County, MN
http://hennepin.us/portal/site/HennepinUS/menuitem.b1ab75471750e40fa01dfb47ccf06498/?vgnextoid=9468bd7d23e23210VgnVCM20000048114689RCRD
Delaware County, PA
http://www.co.delaware.pa.us/depts/ccorrections.html
Stearns County, MN
http://www.co.stearns.mn.us/LawPublicSafety/AdultCriminalJustice/AdultSupervision/CommunityService
Here is a sample policy from Kentucky.
http://www.lrc.ky.gov/krs/533-00/070.PDF
You can also read more about the Midtown Community Court in New York City which deals solely with minor offenses and uses community service sentencing.
http://www.courtinnovation.org/project/midtown-community-court
This report called, Developing a Community Service Protocol offers guidelines and things to consider when beginning your own program. 
http://www.courtinnovation.org/sites/default/files/Developing_a_CS_Protocol.pdf
A similar report from the Community Service Sentencing Project discusses how these services have helped improve the community.
http://www.vera.org/download?file=1411/1587b.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: I have a member in Independence, MO looking for ideas/plans on how to use community service sentencing as an alternative to jail time for government services.  An example would be using community service to help clean city parks.   Any ideas?
title: Community Service for Government Services
